drug.name: Formebolone
drug.description: Formebolone, a derivative of androstane, is an anabolic androgenic steroid. It is on the list of substances prohibited by the Word Anti-Doping Agency, and is regularly screened for in athletes.[A14416] It is also classified by the US Drug Enforcement Administration as Schedule III drug in the Controlled Substances Act. It has been used experimentally in the treatment of growth retardation, and has been noted to increase bone mass.[A14416] Additionally, it has been patented for use in development of novel transdermal delivery systems for enhanced drug delivery.

article.citation: Cuatrecasas Membrado JM, Bosch Banyeres JM: [Study of non-hypophysiary growth retardation treated with formebolone]. An Esp Pediatr. 1985 Jan;22(1):27-32.

drug.synthesis-reference: Canonica, Luigi; Jommi, Giancarlo; Pelizzoni, Francesca; Scolastico, Carlo. 1,11-Oxido steroids. I. 1a,11a-Oxidoandrostanes. Gazzetta Chimica Italiana (1965), 95(3), 138-50.
drug.indication: No approved indications. Studied experimentally as a treatment for non-pituitary growth retardation.[A14416]

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as androgens and derivatives. These are 3-hydroxylated C19 steroid hormones. They are known to favor the development of masculine characteristics. They also show profound effects on scalp and body hair in humans.

drug-interaction.name: Prasterone
drug-interaction.description: The serum concentration of Formebolone can be increased when it is combined with Prasterone.

drug-interaction.name: Dextrose, unspecified form
drug-interaction.description: The serum concentration of Dextrose, unspecified form can be decreased when it is combined with Formebolone.

drug-interaction.name: Propranolol
drug-interaction.description: Formebolone may increase the excretion rate of Propranolol which could result in a lower serum level and potentially a reduction in efficacy.

drug-interaction.name: Lepirudin
drug-interaction.description: Formebolone may increase the anticoagulant activities of Lepirudin.

drug-interaction.description: Formebolone may increase the anticoagulant activities of Bivalirudin.

article.citation: Furstenberger C, Vuorinen A, Da Cunha T, Kratschmar DV, Saugy M, Schuster D, Odermatt A: The anabolic androgenic steroid fluoxymesterone inhibits 11beta-hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase 2-dependent glucocorticoid inactivation. Toxicol Sci. 2012 Apr;126(2):353-61. doi: 10.1093/toxsci/kfs022. Epub 2012 Jan 23.

polypeptide.name: Corticosteroid 11-beta-dehydrogenase isozyme 2
polypeptide.specific-function: Catalyzes the conversion of cortisol to the inactive metabolite cortisone. Modulates intracellular glucocorticoid levels, thus protecting the nonselective mineralocorticoid receptor from occupation by glucocorticoids.

go-classifier.description: regulation of blood volume by renal aldosterone
